subject: subverting Google Maps Street View
body:
Hi everyone,

As a resident of San Francisco whose apartment window shows up in Google
Maps's new "Street View" technology, I'm wondering if there is a way to
subvert the legality of the pictures by displaying, say, copyrighted
material in my window. Or some such.

This is almost entirely theoretical, as I'd much rather display a Yahoo
ad to display my allegiance with their opponent, but given the legal
minds on this list, I thought it might be interesting to hear what
*would* make the pictures illegal, since privacy concerns won't do it.

Thanks,
Erinn

-- 
off the chain like a rebellious guanine nucleotide


-- 
To UNSUBSCRIBE, email to debian-legal-REQUEST@lists.debian.org
with a subject of "unsubscribe". Trouble? Contact listmaster@lists.debian.org
